text:
For a perfect weekend getaway with family, consider a trip to Nagarjuna Island. You can enjoy a relaxing 1-hour (approx.) cruise ride from the boat station to the island, where you'll find a museum and several other historical attractions.

Cruise Timings from the Boat Station:
10:00 AM
11:30 AM
1:00 PM
Please note, tickets are available only at the ticket counter in-person (offline).

There‚Äôs ample parking space for both cars and bikes at the station.

Pro Tip: For the best experience, find a spot on the front part of the bottom deck of the cruise‚Äîit offers the most scenic and enjoyable view during the ride!

This is a historic place with reconstructed monuments. I'd suggest skipping the museum and go for the places visit and comeback to it at the end as museum takes most of the time and the ferry guys give around 1.5 hrs only to explore the island and comeback to ferry.

Beautiful historical place...a must visit. The boat ride to the place was excellent. River water is very clean. 1 hr to go, boat will wait for an hour for you to visit the place and then again another hour to come back. Lot of walking so be mentally prepared.
Very well maintained. Lot of ancient ruins setup properly with care. Good descriptions written.
Nice place to see old and historical place Nagarjuna Konda, AP
Great experience üëç. Boatride upto museum place. üëå

Came from Hyderabad to visit this place. Got here at 11.30 am, but the boat didnt operate due to less of people. They required at least 30 people to run the boat. So, we joined the last trip that was supposed to leave at 1.30 pm. But still the boat leave around 2.30 pm because one group that came by bus had some problems. it took like 30 mins on boat. the weather was pleasant and cool. we got there around 3.30 pm and have to go back to the boat by 4.15 pm because the boat will leave at 4.30pm. it was a very short time. My suggestion, if you plan to go visit, better to come early in morning. the view there was majestic, should take time to enjoy the view other than visit the museum. Overall, its worthy. I will definitely revisit again.
You can reach this island by a regularly run boat service. The price of ticket was very cheap and it is easily a half day activity including the to & fro boat trip.

Such an important Museum being in the middle of a river is ridiculous! If they are serious about wanting people to visit and appreciate the artifacts, they should setup the museum on the mainland where it is easily accessible by the public instead of where it is now in the middle of the river. We are at the mercy of the boats who charge Rs 200 (going rate) and every few months the price keeps going up. And most of the time on weekdays the boats don‚Äôt even launch because there aren‚Äôt enough people to make it worth their while. And if you take the afternoon boat you will only have couple of hours before the museum closes and the last boat leaves.

Boat ride cost ‚Çπ 150 and ‚Çπ 30 museum entry. Located in the middle of krishna river  museum has old inscriptions and sculptures from the past.A walk around the museum and konda will take 1 1/2 hours. No food stalls available in the konda, you can food and water bottles before going to the boat. A unique place where museum is located in a konda island between the river.

Informational. Could take efforts to make rest rooms  cleaner. Boating service is not professional, staffs have no idea about safety, passengers have to pick and wear safety jackets if they want to. Path near island entrance is full of rocks. Elders and kids find it difficult to alight. Organization should make things better for tourists.

Museum with lot of Buddhist artefacts..Can spend atleast one to two hours here enjoying the museum and the scenic beauty outside. The canteen is closed and nothing is available to eat other than drinking water. So pack something before you plan to visit when you have kids.
Maintenance needs to improve a lot. Maximum idols are damaged.

Great Archaeological museum to visit. but there is timing to travel on boat from vijay vihar (Telangana side) to Nagarjuna konda, morning 11:30am  and afternoon 1: 30pm two trips a day, There is no restaurants in Nagarjuna konda. Carry own lunch.
If you want explore go for morning boat 10am and return at 4pm boat on weekends on weekdays only 1 trip of boat is available best place to know about the ancient history

I wanted to share my thoughts on the Nagarjuna Sagar Museum, which I recently had the pleasure of visiting.

The museum is home to a fascinating collection of artifacts that showcase the rich cultural heritage of the region. You can find several ancient sculptures, relics, and inscriptions that date back to the 1st century AD, illuminating the life and times of the historic Buddhist site of Nagarjuna Konda.

The layout of the museum is quite user-friendly, with well-organized exhibits that guide you through the historical context and significance of each item. The informative signage in both English and Telugu enhances the experience, making it accessible to a diverse audience.

One of the standout features is the panoramic view from the museum, which adds to the overall ambiance and offers a beautiful perspective of the surrounding landscape. The serene environment complements the historical depth of the artifacts on display.

Overall, the Nagarjuna Sagar Museum is a must-visit for anyone interested in history and culture. It provides a perfect blend of education and inspiration, reminding us of the rich heritage that has shaped our society.
The boat ride from Haritha Vijay Vihar resort includes Nagarjuna Konda Musium visit. Musium is nice and clean, a must visit place.

Worst experience if you are going with senior citizens as you can see the apathy of the government in maintaining basic facilities. Overcrowded boats with no safety arrangements like safety jackets and also not much seating arrangements leaving you to stand for 40 mins. Approach is so rocky and no queue systems or personal to man the proper crowd management. No provision of any refreshments or canteen services at any place and so called canteen at museum is closed . There is no proper seating arrangements for senior citizens. I hear our ministers go on study tours to see tourist places but what have they learnt is a big question after seeing this lovely tourist place with no basic amenities.

Museum is good. Good collections of monuments from 1st , 2nd and 3rd centuries. It also has collections of instruments and tools used during stone age. It has a toilet, canteen to get water and cold drinks. Food is not great but ok to fill hungry stomach.
Today I visited the museum, it is a great experience.

Boat ride to Nagarjunakonda, an island within the dam is an amazing and memorable experience. Pristine waters, views of  picturesque hills and the visit to the Museum where some of  the ancient sculptures and artifacts found in the excavations are displayed makes the visit a lifetime experience
A small suggestion,please avoid visiting in summer.Best time to visit is winter.Boating starts from 2pm and returns at 5pm.

It's a beautiful 90 minute boat ride into this island cutting across the calm Krishna river. The boat journey itself is serene and beautiful where we get to see the ancient deccani rock formations and clusters. It is somewhat marred by the Dam and it's concrete structures at some points but some may be interested to see that. After the long boat ride you reach this quaint untouched island that gives so much perspective into bygone times. It's a quaint little green island that must ideally be visited for a day long trip if the boat timings allow you to.

Wonderful collection of sculpture panels and lime stone carvings from 4th century buddhism makes it must visit place for history and art lovers.The small carvings in the form of gods carrying the crown of gautama to the heaven,Siddhartha life covering birth,infatuation of mara and death,standing huge female like buddha with one hand broken,lively stupas with harmika and bodhi tree of enlightenment,several horizontal panels depicting morals of Jataka tales,bodhisattva descending on white elephant to take the final birth as buddha to achieve moksha, story of Siddhartha looking at inevitable death in the form of old man before the renunciation, stories of corruption of princess to conquer the throne of old king,social life around buddha from vesantara Jataka tales, unique carvings of donor couples here and there on the story panels,social life events around 4th century on the pillar slabs,preaching buddha on lively stupa with angel guardians, peaceful buddha preaching the sorrow of life to the gods,slightly damaged huge portrait bust of buddha,unique tiny padmapani buddha on big stupa panel,unique designs of garland bearers carrying garland and finally colorful carving of Indra visiting the buddha is noteworthy and shouldn't be missed if you are nearby.
Never knew that we have so much Buddhist heritage here.. After visiting here felt very glad and fortunate to have witnessed it. Must visit

The food is delicious
Especially Biryani was yummy üòã
So good hospitality in service..
Wishing everyone could visit this
Nagajunakonda Museum is in Nagarjunasagar Lake on an island of Nagarjunakonda. Buddhist museum with the collection of various Buddhist structures and artifacts excavated during dam construction

You should visit this place if you are in Nagarjuna Sagar. Check the timings though, so that you can spend some time at leisure to visit different artifacts in the museum. Huge crowds to go to and come back from the place.
Very good destination for picnics and lnowen about ancient Buddhist ERA

The Nagarjunakonda Museum has the unique distinction of being the sole island museum in the whole world. It is located in the midst of the Nagarjuna Sagar Lake in the Guntur district of Andhra Pradesh. Nagarjunakonda was a major Buddhist center at one point of time
Small museum of Lord Buddha situated in an island. It takes 1 hr boat ride to reach here. Boat ticket 150/- museum ticket 30/-.
Very interesting place for people who look for some history. Scenic view of Dam from nearby.

I urge people to take AP tourism boat than telengana tourism. I went in Telangana tourism boat, it is not at all maintained. No life jackets, no one ask you to wear life jackets. No control on where to sit. People brought their own food and spilled everywhere inside the boat cabin. No one is intrested to question them. I saw AP tourism boat, it is neat and clean compared to TSTDC boat. No options to buy water or drink in the TSTDC boat. These are sold in APTDC boat. The boat journey is 2 hrs (one way 1 hr). They allow to spend only 1 in Nagarjuna konda. First go to see the main stupa and later go to museum. It will be very humid. There is a canteen to buy water, drinks etc at the back of the museum. So plan accordingly. There should be a guide or map to explain about the important points to be visited. Atleast 1.30 hrs to 2 hrs are required to visit in detail. I missed to view the stoopa. Later the security guard told me that it is on the other side of the museum. By that time, we have returned and left with 10 min time to reach the boat.
Good trip with kids and family . Much rush in weekends in TS so another option can drive 30 mints to AP and take rooms in APTDC opp you have boating
Gud experience  but there was no food. Avaliable In island....

Awesome place located in the middle of krishna river...we will have boat trip from nagarjuna sagar hill colony to visit this place..try to visit this place in monsoon..never dare in extreme sunny days its very hot climate over here...Good place for the people with regular life style...enjoyed it
One of the holiday spot to enjoy with family.
Excellent location..needs to go by boat from dam..

Enjoy the 1 hr boat ride to the island in the Nagarjun reservoir ..
You can explore the island and know the history of the place by visiting the museum,üëç

Boating experience was very good. It will become one of the best memory in life. While boat runs at high speed, water blows experiencing the feel was amazing and good to photography. Nice place to visit. Buddhism sculpture seen here with Statues.
Watchout insta video to get the sense of voyage tour. :-)
Museum was good.boat ride to the island too.
It is good to see the historical places,every one must see this konda

If you love archaeology, or history this place is awesome. If you want to help ur kids in History, this place is awesome. Ull start with a boat ride for almost 45 mins to this place, and then a flight of stairs to reach the museum. They have kept the place neat and with enough details for explanations.
Bit difficult for aged people, due to the steps. If you are seeking some cool place to hangout, you can avoid. It's very humid throughout the year
Carry enough water and food. Theres no restaurant or shop around.

Please don't have high hopes. The reservoir boat ride is the only high point of this overall experience. We had few kids with us who became very hungry and thirsty but there was no cafetaria in the island. So please keep this in mind.

To reach the Museum we have to go by boating. We have to ticket for boating. No ticket for Museum. Museum is all about Budda and his Statues and coins of his era. Not a worthy place to spend time. For boating is good.

Very bad experience .steamer services are very poor. It takes 1 hr to reach island. No proper  strict safety measures. Staff not bothered if  passengers were not wearing life jackets.   There we're fan and ac installed but not fuctioning. It was suffocating so we sat on top floor but due to extreme heat poor experience. After reaching the island you have to walk for 15 -20 min to reach museum. There is no provision of drinking water. Don't travel with old ppl and small kids. No proper shade to hide from extreme heat.  Whole 3 hour wasted.

The cool thing about this museum is the boat trip to reach it, good place to hangout with family. But make sure the boat timings, cause that's the only way to reach the museum, it's best not be preferable for people with arthritis, cause there is a lot of walking to be done

This place was submersed in the water after construction of Dam. The mountain on which the monks stayed got converted to island. This island was revived by Goverment, they excavated the old relics and monuments, which were partially damaged.
Same is converted to small museum. It hosts lot of knowledge of Buddhism.
Must visit place

Good that the government is preserving the remains of a great history. But the facilities are to be improved. Not up to the mark. Make sure you carry food and water. You may get some filtered water but no cafeteria.
very good place but maintenance is bad

Route to this museum is good and boat ride is nice way to relax but the museum is not that worthy and the trip planning is worse I can say, 3 hours is not sufficient to go watch the place sit peacefully and enjoy the nature there as it's only one hour we spend there.
Awesome place ...a island in middle of a river

Superb place. Though I did not got much time for exploring the places as 1 hour is little less on that island. Need some extra time. Though the place was well maintained and superb. Boat ride to this island was awesome. Will come back for another round for sure. Must visit place from hyderabad

Beautiful island located near Nagarjuna Sagar in Palnadu district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh.
The site was once the location of a large Buddhist monastic university complex, attracting students from as far as China, Gandhara, Bengal and Sri Lanka.

Head to the Nagarjunakonda Island Museum and delve deeper into the history of the archaeological site of Nagarjunakonda. The museum displays Buddhist, Palaeolithic and Neolithic artefacts and ruins that were discovered in archaeological excavations.

You can visit this place from the boat through Haritha Vijaya Vihar resort
Timing: Morning 9AM
Afternoon 2 PM

Well maintained by Archaeological survey of India.
The boat trip to this small island is really nice.
There is a small canteen where you will get water, cold drinks and food.
Its a nice visit

We have been this place on 21st July,2018
We reached at launch station around 11'o clock in the morning, the boat's available from 10 am to 4pm. And they charged for each  adult Rs 150 and children Rs 120 and musium tickets Rs 30 and for children it was free entry for musium. The boat's were clean and safety and they gave life jackets for each and every  one. We travelled around 45 minutes in the water and also they were selling ice cream and soft drinks in the boat while traveling. The journey was awesome . They gave 1hr time to see the musium, the museum was there in the center of the Krishna river. It was full cleaned and inside even cool water we got. The budha museum has so many statues but no guide and posters available to explain about statues and also canteen available over there, canteen food was good. We can see the view of the river from view point then finally we came back with good time. Over all it took 3hrs time.
One can enjoy the boat ride to here.

I never knew that Krishna Valley is packed with such history until I‚Äôve been here. I thought this museum has some buddhist sculptures and stuff. But this is real work of ASI starting all the way from stone age. Must visit and is only a few hours from Hyderabad. A day trip to Nagarjuna konda from Hyderabad would be great.

Museum Maintenance by the staff is good. Sculptures from olden age and stone weapons used them are available in museum. Canteen is available with some limited menu. Visited on a weekend and it is crowdy. School children are the primary visitor's.
Very little time to visit all the places in iland.

The ride to the museum is great... but the museum in itself is not at all recommended.  Its very hot and humid there... no proper place to sit inside...artifacts are valuable but there is not much information about them and also what is the significance of keeping them at that location.
Beautifully preserved. The trip to the hill on boat isnalso adventurous.

An ancient Buddhist site, where Saint Nagarjuna had his Buddhist stupa n university on the island in Krishna river in Nagarjuna Sagar...The Museum exhibits buddhi relic n all things utensils, pottery, knives , sculptures found duri g excavations..
Good Experience in Boat..to reach Museum
Nothing much to see here. If anyone interested to learn about archeological things can have some time over there. But that place and boat rides will be somewhat good if we go in groups.

This museum is situated on an island. It is under Archaeological survey of India. Here you can find many Buddha statues and items excavated from the surrounding areas in early 20th century. Only accessible by boat service provided by Telangana & Andhra govts.
It's a museum of lord Buddha. Though many of the statues are demolished,it's still a good place to visit ..the boat ride feels fantastic!
Nothing is to see . Headless statue of lord buddha
Nice place. This place trvel 1hour in boat after coming this place. Boat prices for Rs 200/- per person
From my point of view - One time visit. Not much to explore until unless you are a archeological geek. Try to skip the visit plan in summer.
One of the best place in indiaüòâ ‚Ä¶

Best tourist attraction spot.
Around 90 mins boat journey.
Worth place to visit.
It doesn't worth it 1.5hours boat journey that to very bad experience i had there
Nice museum where you can find Budha statues and early age weapons and you need to go by a boat to reach there

The archaeological site museum at Nagarjunakonda is a modest museum under the jurisdiction of Archaeological Survey of India. It is named after the Buddhist scholar and savant Acharya Nagarjuna, is situated in Macherla Mandal of the Guntur district, Andhra Pradesh. In ancient times it was known as Vijayapuri (City of Victory), christened after Vijaya Satyakarni, a later Satavahana ruler. Now this valley is submerged under the vast man made reservoir caused by the Nagarjuna Sagar Dam built across river Krishna. It is approachable by motor launches operating from Vijayapuri South. Macherla is the nearest Railway station located 24 km west of Vijayapuri South.The cultural vestiges of this valley, initially brought to light by Shri S.Venkataramayya, a teacher, was made known to the scholars by Shri A.R. Sarasvati in March 1926 CE. Sarva Shri A.H.Longhurst and M.H.Quraishi (1924-31 CE) and T.N.Ramachandran (1938 CE) of the survey under took excavations here exposing Brahmanical and Buddhist structures and retrieved lime stone slabs, inscriptions etc. With the decision of constructing a dam across the river Krishna, the valley was subjected to intensive, large scale excavations to salvage the prestigious relics of the past, by the Survey, under a special project headed by Dr. R. Subramanyam for well over six continuous years (1954-60 CE).Due to this systematic work in over 130 sites spread in 24 square km, a cultural sequence from Early Stone Age to Medieval times was established. The remains of more than 70 structures and an array of antiquities in various media including the reliquaries of the Master and his disciples were discovered. To avoid total submergence, some of these outstanding structures were reconstructed on the island and on the eastern bank of the lake near Anupu and the antiquities are exhibited in the museum. This feat of reconstruction of remains using original raw material following similar ecosystem and alignment is first of its kind.
Such a great experience thanks to telangana tourisum for operating a boat ride,  worth visit and very precious collection of buddha and his disteny

On a Nagarjunakonda island in Nagarjunasagar Lake, there is a museum named Nagajunakonda. Buddhist museum housing a variety of Buddhist artifacts and constructions discovered during the construction of a dam.
Very beautiful place. View of Krishna river is amazing and attractive. You can reach here by bouts.
Not so good. Only Buddhists may like it. One can enjoy only boat ride.
A nice place worth visit and observe amazing ancient master pieces from Indian Archeology!

The boat journey to the Nagarjunakonda was  a good experience.
Ticket prices
Rs. 150 per person for boat and Rs. 30 for the museum.
Nice place to visit but the museum experience is not so great

Nagarjuna Konda Archaeology Museum is a wonderful historical place in Andhrapradesh South India. This Museum showcases the Buddhist cultural and historical monuments. Those who would like to do some research or studies on Buddhist history in India this is the best place.
A Beautiful Island at Nagarjuna konda on the banks of Krishna River, remains of Buddhism. The Island is beautifully maintained,a Historical place.
Not bad... Its OK... Carry ur own stuff to eat because u don't get food their
Museum has good artifacts but unfortunately there is no maintenance and totally ignored by the government authorities.
Must see museum. Sculptures and ancient ruins of Vishnukundina and Sathavaahana Dynasties. It is a Place where once Buddhism was once followed
Greenery was not there and the maintainance is not as expected.It's not a good place to visit in summer.It's better to visit this place in winter.
A fun ride to the place in a boat and a peaceful place to pass time.
The museum is good. Best part is the boat ride to the island.
Very good historical place. Don't miss to look at it.
A place where we can see the different portraits,stories on stones and also pieces of earthern pots.. Loved it
Good place for tourists.. very well maintained meusem.
Some very good artifacts are there. But there's no maintenance.
Good place to visit like a island it is there
Nothing to see, just a waste of time and money
Must visit place for Archeological enthusiasts & Buddhists. Photography prohibited inside the museum.
It is very good and nice place visit.
It's a museum housing the buddhist artifacts found in this region. it's okay to visit.
Sagar boating is good.. Nagarjunakonda museum also nice
Very good place for young kids.
Very nice but insufficient time to explore
No words awesome experience historical place
It has many archaeological statutes showing lifestyle of our ancients.
Not useful information, But historical statues are available to see, We are not able to identify which statue is whose
U well go to boat in 1 hr  journey to museum
U can find very old statues and things here. It's under the central government.
Should have had other things to do other than only museum
Good for one time visit only
Every one visiting place.lanches ate available from hillcolony
Museum is not good or may be I could understand those stones
Nice place to see historical things
One day trip area very gud
Very very nice to see this place
Nothing much to see just enjoy the boat ride
Antiques of this museum belongs to prehistoric period to medieval period.
Thrilling in  boat ride and musium nice
Maintenance is bad inside but outside greenery is good
Ok for a person interested in history and historical artifacts
super and one day tour programe
Not to see more intresting  in next visit.
There is really nothing to see.

Looks like it's closed on Fridays.
Tickets are purchased together with the boat ticket.
Some of the exhibits were on a business trip to New York.

The state of preservation is average, so it is a good place to come for pilgrimage.
The surrounding environment is quite beautiful, but it is difficult for foreigners to understand the contents of its museum displays. A tour guide is needed to introduce it.
